Review.Titre: I can’t ever get logged into my account…
Review.Contenu: I can’t ever get logged into my account My dish was removed from my house and I went a week without internet. The hold time is ridiculous

Review.Titre: We have just signed up for the service…
Review.Contenu: We have just signed up for the service and had the technician scheduled to come out and he could not because of being sick so we rescheduled and then had a no show and a no call. So far the experience hasn't been pleasant. We finally had a tech show up and do the install but it only worked for an hour and now we are having to wait for another service call so hopefully they will actually show and fix it. If they can get it resolved then I will be happy to change my review. I can say the tech support people are very friendly and courteous.

Review.Titre: service only worked for one day now…
Review.Contenu: service only worked for one day now they have to send out a tech to fix 3 days later. called on the 3rd they have no record and now cant send someone until monday another 3 days. this crap, im missing work. switching to rise has cost me money and missing work.

My install was rescheduled 3 times because "tech called in". The 3rd time I sat at home for 7 hours before someone told me he wasn't coming. I had to get aggressive on the phone to stop another reschedule. When I finally got a tech it took over 3 hours to install. Your customer service kept telling me the tech was coming, when they actually were not. Your customer service, just kept saying "sorry for that", but was absolutely no help.

Review.Titre: internet has been out for 5 days
Review.Contenu: internet has been out for 5 days.  Customer service has no ETC for return to service. it's one thing to provide unreliable service.  much worse to not be honest and communicate with your customers about when, how and why?  no website postings.  no facebook posting.   No mailed letters from USPS.  no text messages, voicemails...etc..nothing

Review.Titre: My Internet has been off more in the…
Review.Contenu: My Internet has been off more in the last six months that it’s been on scheduled the appointment waited two weeks. My appointment day comes takeoff a full day at work only to have your company. No call no show asking if they wanted me to schedule another appointment? I run a customer service based business also and if I treated my customers this way I would be out of business! If I could give minus stars, you guys would get -10 stars come on guys

Consistently down. This company is more interested in gaining new customers and not concerned with maintaining 8 year customers at this time. Service call can be scheduled in 1 month, keep paying your bill however or you will be suspended, even though you have no service. Makes sense to RISE! Sorry Sorry PEOPLE.

Internet is constantly out. Even when it “works” it is so painfully slow that loading a basic web page take forever, much less downloading or streaming anything. Months of waiting to speak to a supervisor and the internet still doesn’t work, I still pay them a boatload of money, and I still haven’t been able to speak to someone in charge. At this point it can only be a refusal to call me back with assumption that I’ll continue to just give them money. That time is coming to an end.

Review.Titre: My internet has been out for…
Review.Contenu: My internet has been out for essentially a month. Tech support gives cutesy solutions like resetting the router and that kind of works for a few minutes then it’s out. They even suggested that I “go to Walmart and get a new Ethernet cable for $10.” Days out from a tech coming, I have asked for a supervisor, and after being told I’d be contacted the following, I’ve been waiting 4. Pathetic and useless. Pitiful tech support and an absolutely asinine business model of everyone working from home.

Tech incorrectly installed guy-wires for the satellite mast. Now the wires are ripped loose and slapping my house as the mast sways in the wind. Also, after repeated warnings not to, he ran over my plumbing clean out on the way out. Extremely dissatisfied with that installer. The level of incompetence displayed is completely unacceptable.

Review.Titre: Used dish was installed and am having…
Review.Contenu: Used dish was installed and am having to schedule an appt less than one week after installation as internet is down. It went back online this morning, but is not working again. Called Friday evening, and not able to have technician out until tomorrow, 4 days out. Very frustrating as we use computer for work also.

Review.Titre: Still can’t get a return phone call
Review.Contenu: Follow up to a prior review: the company response to my first was clearly nothing more than trying to publicly save face. Still no phone call from a manager. Not even a returned email after doing as they requested. They don’t seem interested in “making it right.”

Usually decent internet has been almost nonexistent for nearly 2 weeks. Have burned through all my mobile data in the meantime. Called for support but no tech available for over 2 weeks. Can't wait for fiber to be installed soon so Rise can Fall off my bills.

Review.Titre: I have been trying for over a week to…
Review.Contenu: I have been trying for over a week to get an email problem fixed.  They continually hand me to another technician who also can not fix my this internet connection problem.  I  have spent hours on the phone to no avail.  The obvious solution is to dump this provider.  I type into my internet browser a URL and it returns an error. This has been tried on 4 computers.  I take my laptop or iPhone to another  internet provider and it works fine.  On one call I was handed off 8 times no one who could fix their problem.

BE AWARE There had been a fiber cut.  Not their fault.   Someone with a backhoe probably dug up a cable accidentally. I wish that Rise would have designed their network with fault tolerance and resiliency to take an alternative path around the cut.Dual diverse entrance by 2 backhaul carriers to separate central offices is the methodology to use.

I am absolutely frustrated with this company. First of all the nearest tower from where I live is 30 miles, and it makes working from home difficult. I have been unable to work for six days because their Internet keeps fluctuating, and they have yet to increase their upload and download speeds. I was on the phone for two hours, trying to create a new network to be able to work it DID not work!! The technician was nice but seriously had no clue what he was doing! I need to be able provide for my kids.  Whatever you do don’t go with this company.  They need to either make 100/10 available or increase their tower locations.

Review.Titre: This is the worst company I've ever…
Review.Contenu: This is the worst company I've ever dealt with. Not one person knows what'd going on or why there is an outage. Going on 4 days, totally unacceptable.  No communication with their customers and technicians who know zero. Maybe try and know the area your supposedly here to provide and teach your customer service people their job. I'm canceling my service. It's a joke.

Rise Broadband disconnected my service last week with no warning. I have been a customer for several years. The Engineer who called to see me today told me that even Engineering had not been told. I am left with no internet until I find another supplier. This is the worst possible customer service  I would no longer recommend this company’s product.

Awesome job Rise Broadband!!!Customer service was knowledgeable and friendly. I had to make 2 seperate calls with questions. And the installation was a breeze.  The installer was here in a timely manner and very friendly. Answered all my questions!! Which we had alot . Internet service is just becoming available in our country home.Keep up the great job. We will be referring your company to all our neighbors!!!!

Internet service has been terrible. We pay for a plan that should allow us to use multiple devices at a time but we can’t even get 1 device to stream Netflix/Hulu without lagging let alone have more than 1 device connected. We’ve reached out to customer support on the issue and can’t get anyone out to solve the problem. We are not happy with our service and will be canceling if not resolved by end of the month.

Service is hit n miss - unreliable and pricing is incorrect. My neighbor had installation the same day with his bill far less - how does that make any sense?? I’ll be dropping service soon unless these things can be corrected.

goes from 50-20-10-5 and back up ...  if yall want us to remain customers yall have to do better to maintain consistency... I UNDERSTAND I can't get 50mbps 24/7 I don't expect that... but at least consistent speeds of 20-30mbps would be nice instead of the ping spiking and service dying all together and needing me to reboot the whole system to get the internet back on. The hoops I have to go through just to get yall to stay on top of this is ludicrous , and as I said I UNDERSTAND its not perfect but there's no consistency with yall other than consistently bad service

I signed up with Rise and we scheduled an install. I was switching because my ISP was much more expensive and continually losing connection. I cancelled my ISP due to the fact we were scheduled to install. They then emailed and said they don’t service my area after they knew my address and scheduled us. Pretty shady business if you ask me. Will never use or recommend in future.
If I could leave a 0 star review, I could, it's quite literally the worst internet service I've ever had. The only reason I have it is because it's my only option.

BE AWARE #7Here it is Saturday evening. 7:55 PMI had an exhausting day.Turned on the TV for some mindless NETFLIX relaxation.Found  the image to be very Low Res.Checked the download speed. It was 3mb/s.  I am paying for 25mb/s.Where is it?I called support at 7:59No support at this timeI.kbow what I am doing.I have built LANs, WANs, National and international  multipoint networks.Certifications I have held:.CISCO, CISSP,  CEH, RHTC, EMC, and more

REMINDS ME OF DIALUP.Even had difficulty getting to a point to write this review.  Waiting for the screen to come up and paint.It was FRUSTRATING.Getting the RISE BB Speedtest was difficult, tried 5 or 6 times.PING was GOOD at 18msDOWNLOAD was 0.4, NOT  25.0 I was paying for.JITTER was 424ms.  Almost a half second variability in packet response.  AWFUL.  9:30 PM on a Sunday evening.NOT ALWAYS AWFUL,Sometimes it is OK.  Yesterday at 3:35 AM it was fine.

Review.Titre: We are experiencing too many outages
Review.Contenu: We are experiencing too many outages. One was a total mess caused by Rise management not communicating to their it people. We have not had service today 10/8/22 no early all day. Going to start looking for another service.

Horrible company! Every time I call customer service, I’m having to wait 30-60 mins to even talk to a rep. Any time there’s a storm, just know you won’t have Wi-Fi for days… yet we’re still being charged for the service. It doesn’t make sense. I will definitely be looking for another service provider.

Review.Titre: Billing me for service that I DID NOT…
Review.Contenu: Billing me for service that I DID NOT use due to POOR reception and the attachment to the top of the house was/still remains incomplete. The technician even stated he would have to go back & trouble shoot why it was NOT working. We became frustrated and disconnected it after finding that the connection had became dislogged from the house. We used our phones that have HOTSPOT available. So thank you very much but I WILL NOT PAY FOR SERVICES I DID NOT RECEIVE for over 5 months.

If I could give this company no stars I would we never have internet we don’t have any other options for internet because of where we live it’s been two years of we are working on the tower in your area they are full of it. People are rude and they refuse to send out a technician to help us.

We have been having internet connectivity problems for months.We wake up in the morning to find no internet. We sit down to watch TV, no internet, middle of the day we go to do some banking, no internet. At first tried leaving it a while to see if it came back on but it never did. When it didn't we called the company, they'd say there was nothing wrong and there were no outages and everything looked to be working OK their end and suddenly, as if by magic, while they're talking it comes back up. This has happened multiple times now.I don't want to have to spend an hour on the phone 3 times per week because they have diverted service somewhere else.Also, at the best if times, the service they are giving us is less than 75% of the speed we're paying for.We changed to Rise from Hughes because we despised Hughes honestly they were never as bad as this!

Worst customer service ever.  I have never had a more painful experience in dealing with just about any company.  Even the IRS is better than Rise. If I could give them zero stars or negative stars that would be more fitting.  They will do ANYTHING to keep you from discontinuing the service.  The "Customer Care" (Ha!) people cant discontinue the service.  You have to talk to "Customer Solutions" people and 3 times they hung up on me before I could get them to discontinue our service.  They are terrible!

Review.Titre: I have had Rise for years
Review.Contenu: I have had Rise for years. If you need a tech to come out you may as well get a different provider. They take weeks to get your internet going again if a storm or winds take you out. Even though the towers are up and working, you still have no internet for weeks. This is what I absolutely hate, dislike, disgruntled with. Customers that always pay on time are treated like scum. I am starting to look for a new company that treats loyal customers better.

Review.Titre: The only good thing so far was the…
Review.Contenu: The only good thing so far was the installer. Price and unlimited WiFi was not delivered as promised. Have made 3 calls to customer service and we will see if the agreed resolution has been met. Will be checking my credit card statement to see if you hold up your end of the bargain or if we are get screwed once again.

Review.Titre: Failure again.  No help on Helpdesk Line
Review.Contenu: June 30th 8:00PM MDST turned on the TV, and the thumbnails for the programs would not load.  So rebooted TV, and tried again with some success.Then went to the Rise Broadband Speedtest Site.Ran the required three tests.6.7M download15.9 downloadFAILURE -Latency error.16 hours prior I had scheduled a restart of my equipment. Every morning 4AM, there is a scheduled restart.Clearly a bouncing circuit issue.Dialed into the Help line, validated myself, and heard that it would be about a 15 minute wait. Ticket #8754630Sat on the line for 29 minutes and 14 seconds listening to the music, then a click, and "Dead Air".Finally hung up on the "dead air" after 40 minutes.

Switched to Rise last monthInternet went out September 29thAfter a day of getting jerked around, first available service date October 5th. Six days minimum down. I work at home and need a reliable Internet. Rise Ain't it!

Dialup is a lot better, I have had issues since day one. I don't expect much, but the amount of downtime/outages is unacceptable.I am paying for 100 megabit business service and I'm lucky to get 30. The customer service department is very use to dealing with complaints and is very quick to pass the buck blaming your equipment. Sometimes their engineers will mess up and tell you what is really going on, only to have other engineers deny it later.So they either lie to customers or their internal communication is non-existent. Most of their issues are customer service/management related. The employee's don't seem to be too happy with their managers from what my wife and I have gathered. Bad management is usually the foundation of these issues....

Review.Titre: The account was set up in the wrong…
Review.Contenu: The account was set up in the wrong persons name, so I could not access it to get help to resolve the problem. I spent a whole evening on hold , with still no one to resolve the problem. I paid my bill on line, then in the mail received the other parties bill also. As of yesterday this problem has not been resolved.

We have had spotty internet service since February. When called in they say they are aware of the issues. Every time you call in it’s 45 minutes on hold and they act like it’s the first complaint from you that they have ever recieved. Last call they said do not have to call in every day but they will contact me in 2 weeks. I am keeping track of the days we are down. So far 1 day we have HAD uninterrupted service- the rest down at least a portion of day if not all day. IF I had another option I would switch companies immediately. When I sPurchased this 16 months ago- lots of promises which I have the documented text- have not followed thru with 1 promiseNot just us…all neighbors are experiencing the same issues. I have to use my mobile hotspot from cell company to even get internet and it’s costing me a fortune

I'm not even a customer yet and have already experienced a problem with Rise Broadband. I had a scheduled installation  this Sat. between 8am - 12pm. At 9:20 am the morning of the installation I get a call saying that my installation would have to be rescheduled because they're "only" Tech called off. Instead of offering me the very next business day installation, they pushed me out until June 13th. Not a good policy or customer service. Rise broadband needs to better take care of potential customers instead of acting like it's no big deal for someone to rearrange their day to accommodate their Techs and then not make every effort to make their shortcomings right.

Service was set up on Friday and we are already having internet problems. On Saturday, TVs, phones and computers were freezing up, they were slow buffering video. I couldn’t even watch videos that were already set up on my phone.

This company is absolutely unnecessarily so over complicated when it comes to making a payment. That Plus it's like several different customer service individuals that have no concept of notes. I haven't had a situation where 1 person had any history noted in my account. I have set up auto pay every month since I started service with Rise. Then the audacity to charge 10 dollars for a representative to take my payment which has never worked out once. I am looking for another provider. But unfortunately I live in a major rural area and internet providers are few and far between.

They have constant outages and slow speeds. In the last 2 weeks 4 days of outage, every day for the past three days intermittent interruptions in service and speeds of 6 meg download at most. I depend on internet to do my job and you can't depend on Rise.

Frequent slowdowns and outages due to constant issues with their equipment. Very slow to resolve their issues. Poor customer service and tech support. Price increases without notice. Wouldn't recommend. Seek alternatives.

Review.Titre: If I could give this poor excuse of an…
Review.Contenu: If I could give this poor excuse of an internet company negative stars I would. This is the absolute worst internet you can have. “Up to 50mbps” what they actually mean is you’ll be lucky to get 5. FIVE MBPS. It is 2023. Get your sh@t together Rise. As it stands this is just poorly veiled extortion. Charging exorbitant amounts for 3rd world country internet. Any time you try to call about an outage they will ask you to do a “speed test” and it always comes up “everything is fine on our end”. Company is so full of sh@t they should change the logo color to brown. Stay FAR away from this company. I can assure you the “reviews” that these guys are good have been fabricated.

Terrible service, no real support for a crappy product. Slow service that disconnects all the time. Customer service reps that offer no help or just flat out hang up on you. Stay away!! They don’t guarantee the speeds they sell.

Review.Titre: I tried to cancel my account and was…
Review.Contenu: I tried to cancel my account and was transferred and on hold for at least 45 min to only be disconnected. This happened multiple times.  There is no options to cancel your account while you are choosing options.  I am a great paying customer who moved and just needed to cancel the account.  I ordered a new service at my new location.

Review.Titre: The technician did not stay to finish…
Review.Contenu: The technician did not stay to finish the setup. No wall plate just wire through the wall and i haven't seen speeds faster thand 5mb. Extremely disappointed and will cancel my service if it does not improve.

After install I couldn’t use two devices at once because speeds were so slow. Called customer service the next day, they looked and saw that installer used an Ethernet cord that would only allow 10 mbps. Had to purchase another cable that had more capability. When installer ran new coaxial cable the connector he installed at the end has wire and un-shielded wire  hanging out from connector, improper install. While looking at the Rise website for phone number to call about speeds I read what the new customer pricing was supposed to be, they were charging me $20 a more monthly than posted price. I had to tell them they were over charging me. Also nowhere on the website did it say anything about installing a dish. That was a complete surprise to me but since they were the only option at the moment I allowed them to install a dish. As soon as the company that is bringing in the fiber service next month is done I will be dropping this provider.

We didn’t have any issues the first 9 months of service, but the last couple of months have been horrible. The internet is down now and has been for 24 hours. The technicians on the phone are not at helpful and borderline rude. When it was down about a month ago I tried to schedule a service call. The next available date was in 17 days. I tried to explain that I worked from home and couldn’t wait 17 days to fix the internet, but it didn’t matter. Very disappointing.

You promised me 50, your installer said he could only give me 25. My son tested it, showed I was only getting 12.5. I'm only getting 1/4th. of what I was promised, so I should only be charged 1/4th. the fee, right? On another note, when I put in my request you were told of my situation with my shop, first installer was by himself with to short a latter, second installer was the same, no communication, third installers were better equipped and very professional. This was over a period of 3 weeks. Had to buy a 75' cord and relocate the Wi-Fi thing to get my wimpy service to all of my shop. So yeah, so far you suck.
The installation was quick but the speed is horrible.   The speed we get during testing is not even 1 mbps..  This is horrible speed for gaming or other online activities.   Would not recommend.

The internet is extremely slow when we need it the most. After schoolAnd evening for kids to do homework. During the day we have 100mbps+, which is the service we pay for. In the afternoon between 4pm-10pm our speeds slow to 6-10mbps, making it nearly impossible to get anything accomplished. Our internet was not like this the first few months we had it!!

Review.Titre: The installation was good and the…
Review.Contenu: The installation was good and the Technician did a good job.  My dissatisfaction is with the service.  I was hoping to get a better service and i guess the towers are now blocked for what i need.  i am under 10 mb/s

I'll give them 1 star for the courteous people. Installer was fantastic. People I talk to on the phone always respectful and kind. HOWEVER, their internet service is the worst I've ever had. To say it's unreliable is giving it too much credit. I work from home... Since having Rise installed, since DAY ONE - there has not been a single day without an outage causing me to be unable to work...COSTING ME MONEY. I've called, emailed... multiple times. I'm told, "it's an issue with the tower"... For crying out loud how long does it take to make the repairs??? OR change towers. I pay my bill on time every month but can't rely on my internet connection making it through the day. I am horribly disappointed. I live in a rural area where there are only a couple of internet providers. I am praying for another company to come into my area. If I need to be confident of uninterrupted internet service, I have to drive into town to an internet cafe. I'm tired of paying for NOTHING.

Extremely frustrated and dissatisfied with our current service. We’ve been with Rise Broadband for 3 years now and despite many connectivity issues, we remained loyal and hopeful. But, we have had enough. The last 4 weeks have been a complete waste of money. We pay $100 a month and have been unable to completely utilize what we pay for. For the last two days, I’ve attempted to speak with someone who can help me. The first phone call resulted in being hung up on before I could even speak to anyone, yet I was still able to do a review. Poor ratings from me obviously. Today, I called again and was greeted by an impatient and condescending customer service rep. He informed me that my signal was fine (he must think I enjoy making phone calls when apparently not needed). He then proceeds to tell me we need a new router. So, we go out and buy one. Now, we have sat here for over two hours trying to get the Rise modem to connect to our router without dropping every two minutes. I have now been on hold for over 30 minutes and their call center is about to close. The second we are able to switch internet providers, we will 100% be doing just that. Rise doesn’t care about its customers.

Review.Titre: We live right by a tower and our…
Review.Contenu: We live right by a tower and our internet is terrible, doesn’t work half the time, so I ended up just having to use the hotspot on my phone to watch a show on Netflix.

Again another day without internet. If it rains I guess we lose service.  What are u going to say this time time about your crappy service? How can u possibly make it right. Give up and go out of business. I'm also filing a complaint with the bbb, your company can not support service in my area.

Review.Titre: Poor customer service and slow to fix issues
Review.Contenu: Poor customer service. Internet has been intermittent for the last month. Talked to 18 different people still not fixed. Finally scheduled me a service appointment 3 weeks later. Would not recommend.

Review.Titre: The sales department sold me 100 mg
Review.Contenu: The sales department sold me 100 mgPackage, then the tech comes out and says oh you’ll be lucky if I can see a tower from here, and we can only get you 50 mbs. When this is crucial, I work from home. False info, sold a higher package than what you can provide. Sales should have correct info. Huge disappointment

I have had issues with internet ever since it was installed. At first I was told it was my router so I purchased a new one. That wasn’t  the problem and my old router worked just fine. Now my internet signal has been fading in and out everyday for the last three weeks. If I call into technical support they just ask me to unplug the router and plug it back in. Every time I’m told the problem is fixed and it isn’t.

You'd get better service if you attached a note to a buzzard. What a joke. It's down again. I feel like a fool because a few months ago I recommended them to a neighbor. It constantly buffers and then goes offline for hours. Don't waste your time or money.

Originally my service provider was Digis, the company was purchased by Rise Broadband. I have had this internet provider for 25+ years with a few connection issues here a there. Recently I had connection issues that I called about. The tech determined it was the small connection box inside my home and replacement was needed, so I scheduled the appointment. 2 weeks later the box was replaced, connection issues were fixed. But ironically the data usage doubled and we have never streamed movies or been able to with this connection at 200 mbs. I called got a person that told me to change my password and run malware and let them know or she could forward me to cancellation department, what??? I have never had a late bill with this company ever! To act like my years of this company means nothing? You can pound sand Rise Broadband if you treat your customers like that I'm looking for a provider that I can get good help, not a simple change your password and run malware and let us know. No one has hacked into my connection, all the users connected are listed from my router. I'll be leaving this company after this many years. Customer Care sucks!

Review.Titre: Not deserving of the lowest rating available.  Aweful product, aweful service.
Review.Contenu: 1 Star is absolutely undeserving for this company.  Poor quality of service, even poorer customer service, and absolutely rock bottom in field technician knowledge.  In 5 months - over 90 days of downtime on connectivity, 15+ phone calls to technical support with no long term results, and 10+ field technician visits that yielded only 1 defining outcome, and that is that Rise Broadband is a shining example of poor service and product quality.  If you are considering Rise as your isp, and you have any other options in your area - carrier pigeons included, go with the other option.

Review.Titre: Some years service is off 80% and you…
Review.Contenu: Some years service is off 80% and you still get charged full price. They go off line if it's cloudy or rain or wind.Customer Service sucks Would not recommend to anyone
Rise Broadband charged my account more than expected. Once I called the staff about this charge, they told me they would call me back and never did. Multiple times, on multiple days.

I live in Pelican Bay (Azle) Tx and I am now paying Rise $90+ a month for what is supposed to be 50mbps down 5mbps up. As if that wasn't robbery on it's own, I cannot get more than 35-ish max, with the average speeds being between 15 to 25 and lows being down around 4mbps. For several months I had been getting 50-55mbps reliably, even during peak hours, but they sent out one of their "We'll be doing network maintenance" emails for 1/25/22, then shortly after that my download speeds dropped to what they are now. Strangely my upload was running at 20mbps for several days, which was nice. A couple days ago I called them to find out what was wrong, and the support person told me I was actually supposed to only be getting 5mbps for the $75+ I was paying at the time, and that if I wanted the 50mbps that I had already been getting for the past several months, I needed to pay $90. Spectrum is now installed less than half a mile away; if Rise expects to keep ANY of the 350 to 400 households in this area as customers they need to get their service fixed and start engendering some customer loyalty.

Was told to be there from 12:30- 4:30. So I paid someone to be there for me. At 3:30  got a text they were enroute. At 5:30 they showed up and then after explaining our options for set up threw in after we agreed to one that it would cost $100 to set a pole. Tech was knowledgeable and informative about the router and setup of it and friendly though.

Review.Titre: Go somewhere else. Thank me later
Review.Contenu: The worst internet provider I've ever dealt with. You pay them full price for half a months service because your connection is down half the month. And don't try to call them. Half hour before they close the calls get answered and hung up on so you have to call back. And that's a 30 to 40 minute process in the holding que. Then the system kicks you out cause they are now closed. There is no contact for after hours for technical support or customer service. Even their own employees tell you that their service sucks and to not use them if you have a choice. DO NOT DO IT!!!! YOU WILL KICK YOUR OWN A&% IF YOU DO!! TRUST ME, CALL SOMEONE ELSE, PAY A LITTLE MORE!!!! IT IS WORTH IT!!!!!

Review.Titre: I pay for up 50 mbps down load get 17 mbps
Review.Contenu: I pay for up 50 mbps down load. they say guaranteed to at least be 30 mbps download. I get in the teens , 16 to  18mbps. To slow to watch to TV with. And that is the reason I got internet. Very disappointed with Rise Broadband!

Review.Titre: This service has no real technical…
Review.Contenu: This service has no real technical support.  My service went out and it is going to take two weeks for a service call.  Buyer beware

Review.Titre: Service is out of service 70% of the…
Review.Contenu: Service is out of service 70% of the time some years. Very bad company they charge full price for no service. Customer Service socks to

I live in Buchanan Dam Texas and have Rise Broadband. It is absolutely the worst. Customer service has no problem lying to you about anything. "we are doing network upgrades"! Lie!!! "There are guys working on the tower now" Lie!!! I drove by and no one was there. " Sir, I have one of our engineers looking into this. If you do not here from them withing the next couple of hour, I will for sure call you back. LIE!!! Today, 6/6/22, They scheduled a tech. The tech is 3 weeks and 1 day out. As I said, THE WORST!!  But, rural areas, what ya gonna do.

Review.Titre: I have had this company for years since…
Review.Contenu: I have had this company for years since it was Digis.  Earlier this month I got a message that my account was past due.  I know I paid it. Surprisingly I'm able to write this review from a desktop running off of rise broadband internet. Ironically enough, this is the only thing that appears to function. As an avid competitive gamer, it has effectively nullified my past month and a half  or more of online gaming. At the time of writing this review, it is 730pm on august 8th. i have had intermittent to no connectivity since mid June! Completely Unsatisfactory. Ive always had connection issues, dropped connection, slower than usable speeds, etc. but never so bad that i cant sign on at all. ive actually received a temporary ban for the overbearing latency on a rust server. citing "Your ping is so high the server cant tell what youre doing." It literally thought i was hacking it was so bad. Would NOT recommend unless its the absolute very last option. I'm considering switching to satellite or some other alternative. I'm down to using my phones hotspot for YouTube as it wont even load a YouTube video further than 5 seconds before buffering for 10 seconds or more. Its Infuriating!! I've made multiple calls over the course of the past few weeks. Received the same explanations and the same response each time, "You're network issues and connectivity problems are cause by congestion on a tower upstream. Our engineers are aware of the issue, but there is no time listed as to when it will be fixed." <-- Actual quote from more than 2 Actual 'internet troubleshooting' agents. What a joke. I wil be suspending my service very soon if this doesnt get fixed. I will be exploring my other options for internet and will likely choose the first one able to guarantee no intermittency. I was credited for $80 out of $96 of my bill although it was completely unusable. Im still going to have to pay $16 a month for a service I have absolutely no use of. I will be surprised if it even lets me submit this review at this point. -Unsatisfied Customer

BE AWARE #5SO TODAY:In the last 14 hours, there have been  three outages I have been aware of.  Because of their limited support hours, two of those events I could not report real time, or find out what was going on.WHAT THE PROBLEMS ARE from my perspective.RISE has not built a fault tolerant resilient network.  Rise is quick to blame a fiber break on an upstream path, but fails to have a second provider to failover too on their backhaul.   A Level 1 tech has never once provided real assistance.  Level 1 will not get me too Level 2 support.Level 1 support lacks sufficient training, and access to resources.Sometimes Level 1 can confirm there is an outage.  I have informed them at times when there was an outage.  Sure they can ping you inside their IP domain, but that only test one thing.  They need to learn how to use tracert, and other tools.I have even had a Level 2 tech do damage to my configuration, which took me down for days and took Level 3 to sort out.What RISE should do:Allow customers to opt in for a cell phone alert system, so that  when there are outages  proactive text messages can be sent out, with an ETR (estimated time to repair).This would cut their overhead for call center support.Provide paid time for additional IP training for call center tech support.Architect, and build a fault tolerant resilient network.  Defined by a ring, or diverse entrance to facilities of separate carriers.Use HSRP or some iteration of for failover of routers, when doing maintenance, or having failures on switches or routers.  Stock duplicate infrastructure of critical parts with current configs, and code on site.Notify potentially affected customers of scheduled maintenance via text messages on and opt in basis.Hopefully this will reach someone at the C-Level who can budget for some of these resources.If I had another choice of carriers, I would chose it.  Please implement some of the suggestions I have forwarded.Thanks, Ken

Dear Rise Broadband,Your customer service is DEPLORABLE! I’m tired of sitting on hold for ridiculous amounts of time. On Wednesday, 04/20/2022, a technician came out to ensure that my internet antenna pole was secured to the tripod. He said that he secured the pole and that everything was working.I did not check because I was in a hurry to go somewhere. When I returned home, I discovered that I had no Internet.I called and asked that he return to correct the issue, but the call-taker said that I would have to be placed on a waiting list for another appointment.Why couldn’t he have just called the technician, ask him to turn around, and return to my house to correct the problem? We are in the age of technology. Anyone can be located at any time. Everyone is reachable.I work completely from home, and the internet is my livelihood. No internet means no income! I know that this is a very difficult concept for you to understand (really, a person with less than a GED should be able to grasp this concept)—or perhaps you’re so independent that customer service is a disruption of your cushy day.In any case, I am SICK OF RISE BROADBAND, and I will be sure the let others know how deficient, nonchalant, obtuse, and simply substandard you are!Please accept this as my account TERMINATION, and come take your router, dish, and pole. When you access the roof, I have a silicone pad to place between your ladder and the gutter to prevent damage to the gutter. Please do NOT place your ladder directly on the gutter.Not only have I personally inspected my new roof and gutters, I also have pictures of it in its new condition. If the technician who will be coming to remove the equipment causes ANY DAMAGE to my new roof, gutters, or any other property belonging to me, I will take appropriate action.And I am NOT paying the service charge for the call on 04/20/2022.I had to call eight times to terminate the account. Really?!?!When I was finally able to speak with someone in the Cancellation Department on 04/21/2022, she said that she could “have someone come out right away”. Why was that impossible the previous day?By the way, you might want to have someone proofread your automated emails.

Where do I begin?  I've had this service for years.  It used to be decent service but has gradually got useless.  The last four weeks it has been completely dead 80-90 percent of the time.  I called 3 weeks ago and a repairman came.  He couldn't figure it out and said he needed to talk to his boss.  I waited a week and heard nothing from them.  I called back and they said they would contact the field supervisor and either he or herself would call me within a couple of hours.  I waited 8 days, still no call!  I called yesterday and the first representative said they must have updated or moved the equipment on the tower and I no longer have signal.  But they will offer me a discount price if I want to keep it.  I asked to speak with someone over him.  She told me there is too many trees between me and the tower (a mile away from me).  She said there was nothing they could do to give me service.  I asked to speak with someone abover her.  She said he would call me within 24 hrs.  It's been 26 hours and no call!  My service is slow, I get that because I'm in a rural area but to go from it working in January to absolutely nothing in February, is just wrong!  This isn't fair to me.  I've been a faithful customer and dealt with their horrible service for so many years, I deserve a better, reasonable answer.  Not to mention the disrespect of not even contacting me for almost 4 weeks!  Something has happened and I don't think they want to investigate it any further, they just want to get rid of me.  I WANT BETTER ANSWERS!!  Also, I was told my current bill would be credited to a zero balance and it's still showing it due by Feb. 12th.  WHY??????  I'm not paying for service I'm not receiving!!  EDIT:. After seeing Rise Broadband automated reply... I'M STILL WAITING IN YOUR PHONE CALL BACK!

BE AWARE #8  A long one, but worth the read.UPDATE 11/23/2022DO YOU REMEMBER DIALUP?Have tried shopping for a few things.Waited for the screen to populate.Looking at the grey rectangles that are the placeholders for images to be loaded. Waited minutes. Hit refresh a few times.Did the RISE BB speedtest. PING 17ms.  GOODJITTER 174 ms.  POORDOWNLOAD 0.9mb/s I am paying for 25mb/sUPLOAD 2.7mb/s====/====/====/=====/UPDATE 11/22/2022  11:10 amI am trying to schedule some medical stuff, and am having difficulty online with site access and response.So went to the RISE BB Speedtest site, thinking I could see if it was a service issue.It took me a few tries, but the site came up.PING was 16, which is GOODJITTER was 1395, which is AWFULDOWNLOAD is 1.2mb/s  I am paying for 25mb/sUPLOAD 2.5mb/s  that's OK.Recently, how many new customers have been added to the tower I am on?The bandwidth sold to customers has been oversold, over subscribed, causing this "congestion".  /==/===/===/===/====/===/===/Since my last posting there have been so many outages, I have not spent my time noting these.  But last evening was the last straw.  I could not watch TV, response with arming and managing my alarm system was halting, I couldn't close my blinds, or manage some lights (all internet connected).  So called Tech support at 5:13 PM, talked to Irwin.  A nice enough guy.  Before calling I tried numerous times to run the RISE BB speedtest.  After many, many attempts finally got it to run.Download speed 4mb/s  ( I pay for 25mb/s)Upload speed 0.0mb/s (never seen that before)Latency 34 milliseconds. (just to their POP.  WOW!, should be half that.)Jitter 3049ms (HUH! that is over 3 seconds variation in packet latency). Don't know how that is possible.  One would expect a packet timeout first.To see if Irwin had been trained I asked, "What is Jitter?"Irwin started talking about signal strength, and I immediately knew that he knew little about networking.   Jitter is a difference in packet to packet latency variation.I continued, and explained my problems.  Again, he was nice, but just not trained properly.He said there was a ticket opened for congestion.I asked, "When was it opened?"The answer was not what I expected.  "August 29th."Today is November 18th.I asked to speak to someone in Tier 2.  "No one available."  I asked when someone would call me back.  Irwin replied, "24 hours?'I told him, "Unlikely, it was Friday evening, and Monday at the soonest, if at all"  Nine time out of ten times, I never get a call back.I asked to speak to a Supervisor.  At about 5:44PM I was connected  (name sounded like Axel).  He was also pleasant in listening to my tales of woe.I learned that the ticket for congestion opened since Aug 29th was being resolved.  Not so fast with the Hurrah!  Maybe in February.  I didn't ask which year.  I assumed 2023.What causes congestion?Over subscription of services.What is that?Management in its greediness has sold more bandwidth than it can deliver.  Profit is more important than satisfied customers.I had some questions for Axel.  I also apologized numerous time about being an unhappy customer.  The poor service wasn't his fault.I wanted to know if the new fiber coming in February was going to be delivered with diverse entrance, for fault tolerance and redundancy.  This may be over the head of many, but just think redundancy and fault tolerance.He didn't know.  I would not expect him to know, but I want to know if in February (maybe) that the solution being installed will provide a more reliant infrastructure.  While I weigh the future of a SPACE-X implementation.  I asked for him to give me a call back with the information.I don't expect that he will, because his job is geared for handling the minute to minute issues, not the future.  Again, he was a good guy, but just couldn't do much.  He did offer me 50% off for the next 6 months, but given the choice, I would rather receive the the service I pay monthly for.UPDATE, 24 HOURS LATER:Rise BB speedtest site174ms to the test server.  Should be 1/10th this.Jitter 488ms.  This 1/2 second indicates a serious problem, and will cause all sorts of issues when trying to communicate in full duplex,  In other words a conversation.Upload 2.7mb/s download 3.6mb/s  I purchased a 25mb/s service and am getting a fraction of that.ADVICE TO MANAGEMENT:  Take down your speedtest site.  It does nothing favorable for you.===/===/===/===/===/===/UPDATED 11/19AFTER READING THE RESPONSE TODAY From RISE BB....As directed called the 844 number so they could,  "Help me out".The support number works, but no help.  Over subscription congestion still exists.

Review.Titre: Sign me up for the class action lawsuit. Rise Broadband is misleading and negligent of customer concerns.
Review.Contenu: I have a mixed experience with Rise Broadband. When it works, it's like water in the proverbial desert of poor rural internet, but when it doesn't work you are trapped without internet and they are ruthless with their customer service approach. Their local monopoly in rural areas is problematic because they can exploit people with already limited resources. For any powers-that-be reading this, the poor rural internet access problems in the U.S. make us into a third world country (pardon the non pc reference) and will be another layer in our societal demise. As a Rise Broadband customer, we experience consistent, weekly outages. But after a long term outage, no transparency, and inability to get appropriate customer service, I have given up on them. Now I'm here in hope that a class action lawsuit will be eventual, while I limply rant like a troll on the internet using my phone's hotspot. This is a fruitless complaint, but a PSA for future customers: If you're like me, don't give up on other options. I have used my cell provider as a hotspot in many rural areas and it works wonders, especially in a pinch like this. I'm now looking into permanent cellular hotspot with a cellular booster option, which I know exist for RVers (and is baked into many new cars). Try negotiating with your cell phone company to provide your town hotspot options. We should not have to be victim to rural monopoly from Rise Broadband. The future is coming RB, so you better step up with very consistent internet connection that is servicable for streaming and significantly improve your customer service, because this post is a harbinger of bad news. Hotspot prices are annually improving. I'm moving on.
Too much buffering when streaming. It's always been this way. Not a lot of choices in my area.

Review.Contenu: No attempt at discretion was made during any part of the installation. Having used wireless internet services before I was pleased to find it available in our new neighborhood.  I understood that the antenna would have to be mounted on the roof, but assumed the cabling would be run down the side of the house.  I was not at all happy to find that the installer had drilled cable mounting brackets directly through the shingles of our two month-old roof, which are almost guaranteed to become roof failure points in the future.I also am very displeased with the way the cable transverses the roof, eventually drooping over the gutter, then down the front of our house. With a little effort it could have been done in a much more professional manner.

Always going down.  Constantly calling.  They blame the router.  Then they blame cables.  Then then blame a bad wiring connection.  They actually blamed the problem on one of my laptops that wasn’t even turned on.   Then they determine everything is ok.  Later things magically are fine for a while.  Then they go down again, and their monkeys waste another hour of your time troubleshooting The same steps again, blaming everything except themselves, even when you call and their recording says they have a network outage.  Their right hand does not know what the left hand is doing.  Looking for a new provider.

Review.Titre: Impossible to contact a live rep if you …
Review.Contenu: Impossible to contact a live rep if you don't have 30 min or more to wait on phone. My bill has gone up from $44/month to over$60 in 2years. Although the service has not improved and it continues to cut in and out while watching a program I am told this is normal.  I could have had tv, and a phone for a few dollars more.  Rise definitely needs competition in my area - maybe then service would improve and prices would go down..  If I can get someone on the one I am cancelling service since my contract is done.  I would NOT recommend this service to anyone.

Review.Titre: Their employees act so annoyed when you call.

Into week 4 of the issue and I  called to today.  15 minutes on hold and tech  picks up the phone and hangs up!  I called back and had the rudest agent ever. The first thing she did was sigh real loud and say it was a regional  outage.  She would not update me on my open ticket and hung up.  What ISP has a regional outage for 4 weeks and is still in business?

Since Memorial day weekend we have had internet service on a normal day for about 7 hours and this is from the time we get up int early afternoon.  Since my wife is needing to work from home, this means that at least 2-3 hours a day she cannot work.  Resetting the router does no good. Windows network diagnostics always comes back with DND server not responding which tells me it is a problem with the network.  Having dealt with customer service before, I find them to be of very little help since they just have you go through router reset.  And this is what we pay over $70 a month for?  They are nothing but thieves as far as I am concerned.  Don't waste your money on them.

Living out in a rural area, this is pretty much the only provider that is out here. However, the service is laughable most days, at best. The tower I am connected to is severely overloaded to the point where I barely get 5 mbps most days, and I usually have to wait until the middle of the night/early in the morning to do any sort of gaming because the ping is so bad, and also because packet loss can climb as high as 10 percent. (I pay for 50 mbps). Service drops and disconnects are common. Sadly, there isn't much that can be done, aside from upgrading the tower, which I feel certain will never happen. Customer support isn't very good. All the do is tell you to power cycle your router and the radio, which doesn't solve the root problem of the tower being overloaded with too many people. If you can avoid this company, do so.
Very spotty service. Tech support takes a LONG time to even answer. When tgey do they work hard to blame their poir quality on the customer. Terrible business hours

Purchased a 50mb package and receive 1-4mb down speed consistently. 5-10 full outages per day. An SOS on the tower with no information on when it will be working again for 3 weeks. I was told one thing by the sales person and charged another. Probably spent 12 hours on the phone with them so far.  I'd attach a photo of the speeds Ive gotten over the last few months but suffice to say, it's terrible. I moved to them from a 10mb plan w/ centurylink. Centurylink would average 3x faster with their 10mb plan than the 50mb plan with Rise (so far).  Century Link also wouldn't have gone down multiple times daily. I'm going to see this through to find out if they can provide service that matches their customer service. We'll see.

Their employees are nice but the people in charge need to get the dollar signal off their eyeballs and see people are hurting right now! FRUSTRATED.I can't tell you how many tickets I have opened with Tier 2.  But there has never been a call back or followup with me.Whatcha gonna do, when there are few choices for service?

Review.Titre: They're A Monopoly In My Area
Review.Contenu: I have been a customer for 15 years, and I discuss Rise regularly with my neighbors.  Rise behaves like all monopolies do.  They just raised the price of my monthly plan 34% without any notice or explanation.  Their advertised prices are misleading; they add an $11/month "Equipment Rental" and a $7/month "Carrier Recovery Fee" that would be more honestly called "Additional Money For Rise".  I've had problems that took months to get resolved, and been told the lie that my slow speeds were "due to geography" even though the speed had been 3X faster a month earlier!  Of maybe 8 times I've been told that tech support would call me back, it actually happened once.  Rise has the capability to see that your antenna is out of alignment, but they don't check it unless a customer calls in with a problem.  I could fill a book with stories of bad Rise experiences I've had and others have told me.  Most of the employees I've dealt with have been nice, but Rise as a company will frustrate you over and over.  Only competition would force them to clean up their act.

Review.Titre: Rise Broadband gave me a password for…
Review.Contenu: Rise Broadband gave me a password for my internet - it does not work now.  I have tried many times to call in the last three months and gotten no help.  I have been hung up on and hung out to dry. For several weeks there has been a message saying the Caldwell area service has issues - why aren't they getting it fixed?  Yes, now we have a pandemic and I finally got through, the man told me to call back later after I waited so long to talk with someone.  I explained I have tried and this should be easy to fix but he said I can't do it, they have to do it so, he transferred me and I got to hold again until I gave up.  I am having to use my iPhone to get internet in my bedroom.  I can get it upstairs but not in my bedroom and I have an extender.  About a year ago, I called many times about the same issue - no service in my bedroom.  Finally, I got a guy who did something and it worked for a few months.  I do not understand why the people before him could not fix it and why they can't do it now.  The message on the phone says to go to the internet site and click on the red to get help (they mention paying your bill) but when I go to the site, I can't find any help for technical issues - what service.  They really need to improve their service and their technical support.

Review.Titre: I had two months of good service before…
Review.Contenu: Update: They responded with their default response to try and save face, however I've already been through the whole process with their "vip" service the last time they replied to a public comment I made and it resulted in diddly squat.  The bottom line is they are oversubscribing their towers and aren't updating their infrastructure to handle the load.  That is why everyone is having problems.  We are tired of the lip service.  Upgrade your network or accept that you offer substandard service and that customers will call you out until its dealt with.  Original post: I had two months of good service before starting to have problems with slow connection.  It has been 3 years and they have sent out technicians 5 times, each time they told me it was something different causing the problem.  Every time I call I have to explain everything all over again like they have never spoken to me before.  The buck does not stop anywhere at this company.  I think it is obvious that they cannot provide the speeds they advertise, and have not invested enough in their infrastructure to meet the demand.  If you have another option I would go with that.  It couldn't be any worse than rise broadband.  They're even actively trying to prevent you from seeing the bad reviews their customers are writing going so far as to disable reviews on review sites wherever they can, which is completely dishonest.

I've been a customer of Rise Broadband since July 2018. I'm in a 2 year contract. I usually avoid contracts when possible but needed internet in my new location which is remote, and Rise was literally my only option at the time.In the 18 months since having Rise Broadband, I have lost service too many times to count, most recently during the black Friday weekend.. The ridiculous music on the hold line is still burned into my brain from literally HOURS I have spent waiting for a rep. That weekend, I woke up on Sunday to no internet. I had no service until Monday night (Cyber Monday). Therefore I had to wait all day Sunday to place my orders. Not convenient at all.A few weeks ago I noticed my internet speed was below the tier I signed up for by around 20%. After all the days of no service and wasted time on hold, my customer service rep said flippantly "the speed is within our tolerances. There's nothing I can do."For sure, the day I am free of this contract, I'll be taking my business elsewhere. Service from this company may be more reliable in heavily populated areas but in my experience, it is awful in rural places. If you have another choice, I recommend you go with it. Also, the "gift card" I was promised under the contract took several phone calls and unanswered explanations before I finally received it. The only reason I'm giving Rise 2 stars is because they do in fact provide service. But that's as good as it gets.

BE AWARE #3 This is my 3rd installment.  Last night 10/10/21 at 21:52 MDST I started experiencing packet loss.  I knew tech support was not available at that hour, so waited till the next morning.  Called in about 05:35 and after a very brief wait Leo answered.  Told him I was still experiencing packet loss at this time. He said he would run some tests to the tower.  I waited.  He said it all looked good to him.  (Sorry to now get technical for 99% of you).  I asked him how he knew he was taking the same path from his office in Loveland CO that I was.  He was unaware of this.  I explained that I had seen multiple paths through the BGP area, and how could he know that I was hitting the same hops he was.  I inquired about the tests he ran, and asked if he was sending 32 byte packets.  He confirmed.  I said, “Why don’t you run 1400 byte packets to simulate the streaming type traffic I run.”  He answered, “That was not policy.”  I asked if this was a written policy.  He answered, “No, but he had not been trained in that (running packets of the type customers run).”  I asked for tier II.  Leo put me on hold briefly, and came back, and acknowledged that there was a packet loss issue.  He explained that this can happen during peak traffic periods.  I agreed with Leo that there was a problem, but disagreed that it was due to high volume of traffic.  All in all Leo did his job, and did it well I do not want to get him into trouble. WHAT I HAVE A PROBLEM WITH are two things.  ONE, 5:AM is not a peak traffic time.  TWO, the system should have been built to handle all subscribed traffic, and not suffer because of this.

BE AWAREHave experienced many outages.Rise offers a 24X7 service,  but only supports their service part of the day.  Residential customers are not supported after 10:PM, until 5AM.I can't run my life according to their schedule. Rise, has had core routers and switches go down.  This shows lack of knowledge and planning to provide a fault tolerant, resilient network.   These devices should have redundant equipment and paths, that allow switching over in no more than 300 milliseconds. BE AWARE These microwave signals can be interrupted at any time by radar in the area.  FCC regs requires Rise to switch to an alternate frequency anytime a radar signal is detected. Just in case there is military or other radar detected.  Rise is supposed to automatically roll through 4 alternate freqs, to find a non conflicting freq.  If this works properly you will be out of service for 30 minutes.   It doesn't always work right.  And manual intervention is required; and you are down even longer. BE AWARE I feel sorry for the 1st level techs who have to support all the callers. They can't fix any system level issues, and don't get frequent, and deep enough information to give customers a warm and fuzzy feeling.   Typically they don't have ETR, estimated to repair imfo.  This gives the appearance that management is second string.BE AWARE I have sat on hold for extended times, and been offered to leave a number for callback.   Have never gotten a callback.Have had a first level tech, Julie, tell me that someone would give me a callback for the packet loss issue.  No one ever called me back.But if this is all you can get, go for it
Signal weak.Cuts out.Have to tested modem alot.

First, I'll say they throttle your speed when you reach a certain data limit.  Make no mistake about that. They won't tell you that when you sign up; in fact they deny it; but they do tell you that when your speed is so slow it harkens back to the days of poor dial up.   So, if you stream all of your content, Rise is not the choice for you.   If you just need it for every day ordinary internet access to a PC, laptop or phone, then it's probably fine.  But if you use any streaming service, *poof.  And, just try to cancel.  Wow!  They make it almost impossible.  Run arounds, extended holds, numerous customer service representatives, more promises of better speeds, and finally a literal audio loop of "hello, customer, we can't hear you; hello, customer, we can't hear you".   And you can't cancel via email or chat.   Only after we sent a certified letter and made two more phone calls were we able to cancel our service.   So, be warned.  They actually told me the service would remain open and active until we were able to cancel by talking to them.   NUTS! To explain my rating of 2 across the board:  Customer Service:  as long as you're an active customer, the customer service is decent with the exception of the guy that told me we were being throttled because we use too much data and he couldn't help me in any way.Speed:  For the rural area, it can be decent.  Sometimes, 50 mbps.  But that with minimal devices connected at once.  Plus, the tower was literally across the road from our home.   When we had multiple devices it was still okay.  But once you reach that data limit, it's atrocious.  Reliability:  Quite a few tower issues along with speed throttling made it pretty unreliable in a lot of cases.Value:  Compared to other "line of sight" internet capability with the same speed promise, it's about even across the board.   But compared to neighbors that are actually in range of available fiber, the Rise plans are much more expensive for less.

I gave them 2 stars because at least I have internet. That is somewhat of an undertaking when taking my location into account; I live in a rural, wooded area. When I called Mediacom about internet the guy I spoke with said, "Yeah, we looked at that area. It's not gonna happen. Ever." So Rise deserves 2 stars for getting me internet. Now, about that internet. I had a guy come out prior to install to come up with an installation plan. When installing, he ended up mounting the dish to the utility pole next to the house. He said they're not technically allowed to do that, but he would have to come back with a team to dig a trench to bury the cable to be able to put the dish close to the road. That was in July. It's now February & the dish is still mounted on the utility pole. During the first 3 or 4 months we had the service, the signal would drop CONSTANTLY. I work online and meet with clients on video call. The quality is not very good, and we experience significant lag at times, like 5 seconds. I would have to keep my mom's phone in the window (where it got a single bar of reception) to switch to her hotspot when the internet signal would drop. Her one bar of reception hotspot was actually better quality. If I could use that all the time, I would, but there's only a 10gb limit. The internet would go out so randomly, it got to the point where I would joke that the sun must be too bright. It has gotten some better in the last couple months, perhaps because there are no leaves on the trees. It's still not great though. My husband is a soccer fiend & has been trying to watch the Cup of Africa. He tries to watch on 720p, but the connection is usually too slow to handle that. It stops every few seconds to buffer, while he misses important plays. It's difficult to watch soccer with a resolution less than 720p because it gets too grainy to see the ball. We don't have any other devices using internet while he's watching either. Even web pages on my phone take their time to load. There are certain pages like Home Depot and even Amazon that seem to be a bit much for this connection. At one point, I was being passive aggressive & didn't pay my bill because they weren't giving me the service I was paying for. I figured if they don't want to install it correctly, I don't want to pay my bill and shouldn't have to. I also was trying to bring attention to my service. That didn't work for me because not only did I have to pay a reconnect fee, I also had to pay a late payment fee, adding $55 to my bill. I guess I won't do that again. I'll just leave reviews instead.

Review.Titre: had to get new router and not tech. savvy
Review.Contenu: So I'm glad I got internet with Rise but I wish I would have known that the router I already had was old before your service guy came out. Also I'm not very tech. savvy, so the manual was extremely to figure out and very misleading on the new router I had to get. Took me 2 hours and day to figure out how to get internet set up, and I had to make 2 separate phone calls. One to your Tech support and the other to my router's tech support when all I needed to do was go to this 1.6 number (website) and set up an account. The Router I got made no mention to do any of that. Providing that on the router's instructions would have made the process a whole lot easier, and would have taken me five minutes to do vs. 2 hours and a day. I know you can't do much about getting the 1.6 number (website) added to the Router's Instructions but it also would have helped to ask me ahead of time what kind of router I had (the make and model number or serial number or something and see if it would be compatible with your service, and then if the customer is not tech. savvy (more likely than not) and they do need to get a new router, then walk them through step by step how to set it up.
I was put on hold for over an hour over and over again before everything was finally resolved

The main issue I have is with the Router App. The  Deco App. Its confusing to control, it's not flexible enough like others, it wont allow me to shut off ALL the internet in 1 button only 1 of the 2 Megahertz options, which gives me 0 control of shutting down the house if I wanted to. Because the parental controls are clunky, I have to "backlist" each kid or person I want off the internet in order to pause them... because the pause or bedtime parental controls have never worked and my kids can play still use the web, despite it saying it's working or "timed out" it's a rough app that needs to be simplified, it's been 5 months and it frustrating every day as a parent. I've experienced way easier apps then this one.Overall we are happy with the rural Up and Down load speeds, considering our rural limits. We have experienced lately more issues with the router being selective with others computers and tech, shutting internet off all day for one and not other...lately we have been resetting the router everyday last few days. If this keeps up, rating should be lowering.

Review.Titre: I had issues with my internet
Review.Contenu: I had issues with my internet. For 2 weeks it would work then disconnect, slow speeds and got slower and slower until it was under 1 download. I called to get it fixed and they said it would be 2 more weeks. I was told by the CS rep to call for a credit once it was all fixed and working again. So I did today. Asked that they credit me for the month that my internet was not working as advertized. All the rep offered me was credit for 2 weeks. Basically the 2 weeks I had to wait for someone to come out. I am a disabled vet and my daughter is doing college online from home, but for the last month she has had to go else where to get her work done. That means she had to go out during the one time we were all being told to stay home, because the internet wasn't working. I'm not asking for anything that isn't fair. Just want the credit for the month I didn't get what I was paying for. It is a shame that I have to go through all of this over $69.34.  PLEASE DO WHAT IS RIGHT!  But they refuse to credit beyond the 2 weeks. Where has customer service gone to? Finally was able to get the credit. In the end, They did what was right, but nobody should have to jump through these kind of hoops to get fair customer service. I hope this doesn't happen with anyone else and they have hopefully made some changes. Besides this issue, the service has been top notch. Having dealt with AT&T and Hughes net, I would recommend this company over the other 2 any day. Thank you Rise.

Review.Titre: The Best Is Worth The Wait!
Review.Contenu: The Best Is Worth The Wait?Me thinks so!  We have been living in Buchanan Dam since 2008 and during that time have had several wifi/internet carriers, the most recent and successful of all being HughesNet, BUT the signals were intermittent at best, typically really weak and ever so slow.  We'd been pining for fixed broadband and RISE ever since we'd heard about it from satisfied neighbors but our house was a geographical oddity with no direct sight-line, alas.  With the addition of a new tower from which our roof's receiver can now obtain a signal we are happy - ever so happy - to report that we've got REAL internet - speedy wifi, quick downloads and uploads and STREAMING service (which we were calling "buffering service" for the consistent and predictable pinwheels we'd get every 1.42 - 2.56 minutes of a moving - it took HOURS to watch a 1/2 hour show!!The install process was a BREEZE - there's just no other way to describe it, especially compared to the satellite service(s) we'd had in the past.   We got three extenders but probably didn't need them (the signal was already stronger - even at our waterfront dock - AND FASTER than our previous 5G service).  We're thrilled, love Love LOVE Rise Broadband and so glad we're able to finally be customers!

The question was “how was your experience,” not “how is...”, and that’s the question I intend to answer from the perspective of being an IT developer who also does extensive homestead work. The installation was fair, we had to provide a taller ladder despite previously indicating how high our roof’s peak was at 27’, but that’s fine. Previously we had Cool Access years ago, (bought by Netport, bought by Rise), so we had an existing hole in our inside wall. Since having new siding put on, I drilled from the inside to the outside to help speed things along. The hole was in the most ideal location, right under a siding edge and thus utilized. What made me unhappy is the hole wasn’t sealed. I had asked earlier about sealing and had heard “we always seal...” but dad heard “we never seal...” I ended up sealing it that night after configuring the network. The installer also said they usually don’t use wall plates, but just have a cable sticking out through the wall. Fortunately the installer had and provided a wall plate as I believe one should rightfully expect for a paid installation.They did provide a router contrary to was was indicated, but for a paid installation one should expect that. Unfortunately, the only network configuration done was, “your Wi-Fi name is this and your Wi-Fi key is this.” Our previously established and extensive wired network was totally ignored, and we’re not willing to drop our current DSL service until we can verify the reliability of their service. I can understand and accept this protocol, but this was a paid installation and I suppose I misinterpreted what “help you get set-up” meant when signing up. I’m aware that we can’t have both connections simultaneously without a multi-WAN router, but we just wanted to switch between them when needed and use our existing AT&T router for the wired network.Not being as savvy or refreshed on network configurations as I am with web development or general programming, I spent the rest of the evening determining how to get them to play nice with one another. It was a matter of disabling the DHCP of the router who’s WAN you didn’t want and enabling it on the router who’s WAN you do want, and from Windows command prompt, “ipconfig /flushdns” and “ipconfig /renew” (in addition to disconnecting a reconnecting the physical LAN cable to the computer or even rebooting if needed). This was verified by a knowledgeable Rise Broadband support rep, so despite some initial trouble with my dad’s PC, everything else worked out pretty smoothly afterward.Lastly, the service itself has fortunately been beyond expectation. However, considering they recently installed a tower somewhere visibly behind our neighborhood and the antenna is mounted atop our 27’ roof, that was to be expected. We get exactly the rates we’re paying for with the basic service, and even up to 17Mbps in nasty weather so far. This is where the fourth star came from in my review, as while the installation experience was fair at about 3 stars, I didn’t want to undermine the 5 star service we’ve been getting so far. A friend put it to the test playing Minecraft on an Xbox One while it was downloading who knows how many gigs of game updates. No game lag from other players with good connections and an average Google ping response of 76ms with 3% loss during that hour. Only one evening did I suddenly loose connection to certain websites, including Google, wixmp, and pishop.us, which was quite strange. Seems it was resolved in a couple hours though.Thus chronicles my experience so far and I hope someone finds this helpful!
